newsitem.title: FINLAND: RAUMA SAYS DID NOT BUY PONSSE.
newsitem.headline: RAUMA SAYS DID NOT BUY PONSSE.

text.p: Finnish engineering group Rauma Oy said it had not bought the 9.3 percent stake in forestry harvester maker Ponsse Oy sold on Thursday by Eero Suutari.
"The answer is no," Rauma chief financing officer Sakari Tamminen told Reuters by telephone, when asked whether Rauma or its forestry harvester unit Timberjack had bought the Ponsse stake.
Eero Suutari, previously one of the biggest owners in Ponsse, said he had sold his entire holding in Ponsse through brokerage Protos, but did not know, who was the buyer.
Tamminen said Rauma had no plans to acquire Timberjack's rival.

"Ponsse is a local company so there would be no industrial logic (in the acquisition)," he said, noting that Timberjack is a global player, which has in Finland the same type of products and operations as Ponsse.
Ponsse's 1995 net sales were 314 million markka, while Rauma's Timberjack had net sales of 2.76 billion markka.
Rauma, which had a 9.8 billion markka net sales in 1995, has said earlier its high solidity and strong cashflow would allow it to seek growth through acquisitions.
